description: From Latin corrādō (“to scrape off, abrade”).

verbs.description: corrade (third-person singular simple present corrades, present participle corrading, simple past and past participle corraded)

entries.meaning: (obsolete) To gnaw into; to wear away
(geology) To erode through physical or mechanical (rather than chemical) means, as the bed of a stream.
(obsolete) To scrape or rake together; to accumulate laboriously.
